Today I intro’d a new bill to help protect safe and affordable housing options for Hoosiers: https://www.young.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/senators-young-and-wyden-introduce-legislation-to-protect-affordable-housing …

Congress must also address the true driver of our national debt – runaway, automatic entitlement spending – which is crowding Congress’ ability to perform its most important responsibility – provide for our national defense. https://www.young.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/young-ndaa-critical-to-indiana-and-national-security …

#FY20NDAA is critical to Indiana and our national security. I agree with President Trump: Our brave service members should have all the resources necessary to ensure they never have to enter a fair fight. pic.twitter.com/XU53biX89b

As I have said repeatedly, we must stand firm on our maximum pressure campaign on Iran - the world’s leading state sponsor of terror - while also ensuring Congress fulfills its constitutionally mandated role to authorize the use of force.

I share the concern of many of my colleagues about the role Congress must play in authorizing the use of military force. Rather than derailing the #FY20NDAA process and jeopardizing its many important provisions, I’ve requested that we have this conversation in the committee.

Because @SenatorRisch has agreed to hold this hearing, I will not support an amendment proposed by Senators Udall and Kaine that would jeopardize passage of the #FY20NDAA – the annual military funding bill the Senate is debating this week.

BREAKING: @SenateForeign Chairman @SenatorRisch has agreed at my request to hold a hearing regarding U.S. military action against Iran. https://www.young.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/young-secures-aumf-hearing-in-senate-foreign-relations-committee-will-oppose-aumf-amendment-to-ndaa …

There are approximately 70,000 amputee veterans, 100,000 paralyzed, and 130,000 blind veterans in the United States currently. When traveling, passing through airport security with prosthetics, wheelchairs, or other mobility aids presents a challenge.

Learn more about our resolution: https://www.young.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/young-and-murphy-resolution-to-force-vote-on-saudi-arms-sale …

U.S. arms sales demand effective Congressional oversight. The ongoing humanitarian crisis and security environment in Yemen, where Saudi Arabia is engaged militarily, requires our sustained attention. All forms of U.S. assistance must help those in need, not worsen the conflict.

Following an emergency declaration last month to sell arms to Saudi Arabia without Congressional approval, I’m joining with @ChrisMurphyCT to introduce a resolution that would force a vote on arms sales and other security assistance to Saudi Arabia.
